page.title: 07BIDDISHAM LANDSCAPE
page.content: OUR JOURNEY OFF THE A38 THROUGH BIDDISHAM VILLAGE WAS ALONG A ROAD NEW TO THOSE OF US TAKING PART. FOR THE FIRST KILOMETRE WE PASSED LARGE COTTAGES SET IN THEIR OWN GROUNDS AMID FLOWERS,FRUIT TREES AND VEGETABLES.WE LEFT THE HOUSES TO FIND THE ROAD FOLLOWING THE COURSE OF THE OLD RIVER AXE.THE WAS FULL AS IT TWISTED AND FURNED TO JOIN THE MAIN RIVER. THE FIELDS ALONG SIDE THE RIVER WERE RICH WITH GRASS.SOME FIELDS HAD BEEN CROPPED AND BALES OF HAY WERE AWAITING COLLECTION. COWS BROWSED ALONGSIDE THE RIVER OR LAY CONTENDEDLY CHEWING. WITH THE SUN SHINNING,THE LANDSCAPE INVITED US TO LINGER RATHER THAN TO CONTINUE OUR EXPLORATION.
